title: Quick Desk Stretch
description: Take 2 minutes to stretch your neck and shoulders. Gently tilt your head to each side, roll your shoulders, and stretch your arms overhead.

title: Mindful Breathing
description: Take 5 deep breaths, inhaling for a count of 4, holding for 2, and exhaling for 6. Focus only on your breath.

title: Water Break Reminder
description: Set a silent alarm to remind you to drink water every hour. Stay hydrated to reduce fatigue and improve concentration.

title: Proper Desk Ergonomics
description: Adjust your chair so your feet are flat on the floor, knees at 90 degrees, and eyes level with the top of your monitor. Keep your wrists straight while typing.

title: 20-20-20 Eye Rest
description: Every 20 minutes, look at something 20 feet away for 20 seconds to reduce digital eye strain.

title: Tension Release Meditation
description: Close your eyes and focus on tensing and then releasing each muscle group in your body, from toes to head. Take 3 minutes to complete the exercise.

title: Discreet Hot/Cold Pack
description: Keep a small reusable heat or cold pack in your desk drawer for quick pain relief. Heat is good for stiffness, cold for inflammation.

title: Schedule Focus Blocks
description: Block 25-minute segments on your calendar for focused work with 5-minute breaks in between. This helps manage energy levels throughout the day.

title: Standing Meeting Option
description: Suggest or choose standing meetings for shorter discussions. This reduces sitting time and can increase energy and engagement.

title: Email Batching
description: Check emails in 2-3 scheduled blocks per day instead of constantly. This reduces stress and improves focus on priority tasks.
